taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Arabic melóchich , name for Corchorus olitorius Linnaeus, a salad plant in the East]

bio:treatment.description: Herbs, annual or perennial, subshrubs, or shrubs [trees], erect, spreading, or decumbent, taprooted. Stems unarmed, hairy, hairs usually simple and/or stellate, sometimes also glandular. Leaves petiolate; stipules usually deciduous, linear-lanceolate; blade: margins rarely present; anthers 2-thecate; ovary 5-locular; ovules 2 per locule; styles 5, distinct or basally connate, filiform; stigmas included, decurrent on style, papillose. Fruits capsules, pyramidal and 5-winged, or schizocarps, subglobular and not winged, dehiscence loculicidal, sometimes also septicidal, fruit then falling apart. Seeds 1 or 2 per locule, obovoid, with 2 flat sides and 1 rounded, smooth; endosperm present, fleshy; embryo straight; cotyledon flat. x = 7, 9, 10.

references.reference: Goldberg, A. 1967. The genus Melochia L. (Sterculiaceae). Contr. U.S. Natl. Herb. 34: 191–363.
